context: The most widely used symbol is the <a0_0><b5_0>flag of Greece<b5_0/>, which features nine equal horizontal stripes of blue alternating with white<a0_0/> representing the nine syllables of the Greek national motto Eleftheria i thanatos (freedom or death), which was the <a1_0><b6_0>motto of the Greek War of Independence<b6_0/><a1_0/>. <b7_0>The blue square in the upper hoist-side corner <a2_0>bears a white cross, which represents Greek Orthodoxy<b7_0/><a2_0/>. The Greek flag is widely used by the Greek Cypriots, although <a4_0><b8_0>Cyprus has officially adopted a neutral flag<b8_0/><a4_0/> to ease <a3_0>ethnic tensions with the Turkish Cypriot minority<a3_0/> – see flag of Cyprus).
